name: undistorted
content:
undistorted adjective
(NOT FALSE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not false or wrong: These days science is usually regarded as providing the undistorted view of reality. Events must be presented in a fair, accurate and undistorted way.

undistorted adjective
(NOT CHANGED)
not changed in a way that makes something worse than it was before: undistorted by Curling remains a pure sport, undistorted by relentless advertising. What ordinary people need is lower rents undistorted by tax and housing benefit subsidies to landlords.
More examplesFewer examplesThe report was about ordinary people and their present, real life experiences, undistorted by ideology.They campaigned for a free market undistorted by government intervention.Undistorted by city lights, the sky above the village was a beautiful canopy of stars.The government will create a regulatory framework for energy markets and promote undistorted competition in these markets.

undistorted adjective
(SOUND)
If a sound produced on electrical equipment is undistorted, it does not sound strange or unpleasant because of changes in the shape of the sound wave: If you do a direct digital transfer of an undistorted recording, its maximum volume is determined by the loudest sounds on the tape. Dynamic range is the difference between the quietest audible sound and the loudest undistorted sound.
More examplesFewer examplesThe speakers provide rich, undistorted sound when set at a moderate volume.The sound of this year's concert was a much more natural sound, with clear and undistorted vocals, and a wider dynamic range.
